context: There was a security incident involving system recovery setting tampering on the device `vnevado-win11u`. Adversaries might be attempting to delete or remove built-in operating system data and turn off recovery services to prevent recovering a corrupted system. Specifically, the commands 'vssblatemp.exe delete shadows /all' and 'bcdedit /set recoveryenabled no' were executed on the host `vnevado-win11u` which could indicate an attempt to disable or delete system recovery features.
question: What is the name of the host involved in the deletion of file snapshots and shadow copies during the subsequent ransomware infection?
solution_steps: There was system recovery setting tampering observed on this device by the user with SID `S-1-5-21-1840191660-8534830288-125585561-1522`. Adversaries may be attempting to delete or remove built-in operating system data and turn off recovery services.
All file snapshots and shadow copies were deleted on the host `vnevado-win11t`, which is common during ransomware infection.
